title: Basic Education Course on Intermittent Medication Therapy

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Online course based on Gagné’s Nine Events of Instruction, applying systematic design aligned with learners’ cognitive processes

learning_goals: Explain the principles of pharmacological treatment for liver disease patients with 80% or greater accuracy
Students can apply medication dosage adjustment criteria for impaired liver function to real-world cases.
Students can identify five major symptoms of hepatotoxic drugs and propose response strategies.
Students can retain over 70% of learning content for up to seven days using digital learning materials.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
